content:
You are correct, I apologize for the confusion. When only L\_i exists, the allocation for animal i should be capped at L\_i rather than M\_i. Here is the corrected mathematical formula:

For each animal i:

* Calculate the proportional hunger level as: H\_i / (H\_1 + H\_2 + H\_3 + H\_4 + H\_5)
* If total\_hunger <= F, allocate food as described in the previous answer:
	+ Let F\_i = min(max(F \* proportional hunger level, L\_i), M\_i)
* If total\_hunger > F, allocate food as follows:
	+ Let total\_hunger = H\_1 + H\_2 + H\_3 + H\_4 + H\_5
	+ Let F\_i = min(max(F \* H\_i / total\_hunger, L\_i), M\_i) if both L\_i and M\_i exist
	+ Let F\_i = max(min(F \* H\_i / total\_hunger, M\_i), L\_i) if only L\_i exists
	+ Let F\_i = min(max(F \* H\_i / total\_hunger, L\_i), M\_i) if only M\_i exists
	+ Let F\_i = F \* H\_i / total\_hunger if neither L\_i nor M\_i exists

Thank you for bringing this to my attention!
